intro: Navarretia latiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are broad and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Navarretia latiflora is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
